cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi (70 km) NW of Cabo San Lucas, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest along the length of the Baja California peninsula, then curving northwest and weakening over the Pacific south-west of southern California
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Baja California Sur near Cabo San Lucas

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Baja California Sur from Puerto Cortes to east of La Paz; Tropical Storm Watch for portions of central and northern Baja and mainland Mexico north of Bahia Kino
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Baja peninsula from Punta Eugenia to Bahia San Juan Bautista and mainland Mexico from Bahia Tempehuaya to Bahia Kino
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Baja California peninsula, western mainland Mexico, coastal Sonora, and eventually the far southwest United States coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; otherwise breezy conditions Sunday–Monday
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain and localized flooding late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the Southern California coast beginning this weekend
